content.description: Easy warm up route with a good photo op. Crux is the sit start where you find the hands as low as you can go on the crack without getting cut on the sharp rock. For an extra challange, avoid using the arÃªte halfway up and dyno to the top!
content.protection: Pads, or just someone there to spot you.
content.location: On the South end of the Monkey Rock collective, one of the South most boulders with the crack running up.

content.description: Start low at some edges on the left side. Go up a little with your right hand then up further with your left to a small lip. Then lunge around the arete of the boulder to a large hueco. From there either top out or go out to the left to nice holds and top out there.
content.location: When at Monkey Rock and facing the lake, turn left and you will see the large boulder with a large hueco on it up the hill maybe 10 yards away.

content.description: A lot of granite boulders in a small area. The boulders are smaller compared to others in the Tahoe area. The boulders' texture is amazing.  Most of it is hasn't been fully climbed yet, so discovering a new route is very easy. While bouldering, you get an amazing view of the lake and of Monkey Rock.
